newsArray.title: List Of Highest Run-Scorers, Wicket-Takers After Mumbai vs Vidarbha Ranji Trophy 2024 Final
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description:
Mumbai vs Vidarbha, Ranji Trophy 2024 final highlights: Ajinkya Rahane-led Mumbai secured an emphatic victory in the Ranji Trophy 2023-24 season, clinching the title for a record-extending 42nd time. Facing off against Vidarbha in the Ranji Trophy 2024 final match at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai emerged triumphant with a convincing 169-run win. Despite Vidarbha's valiant efforts, they fell short, managing only 368 runs in their second innings while chasing the daunting target of 538 runs set by Mumbai.

Mumbai's victory reaffirms their dominance in Indian domestic cricket. Moreover, Mumbai's triumph comes after an eight-year wait since their last title win in the 2015-16 season, where they defeated Saurashtra to lift the trophy.

Ranji Trophy Final 2024: List of highest run-scorers

Player Team Average Runs
Agni Chopra Mizoram 6 678
Ricky Bhui Andhra 8 775
Sachin Baby Kerala 7.83 830
Cheteshwar Pujara Saurashtra 8 829
Narayan Jagadeesan Tamil Nadu 9 816

Ranji Trophy Final 2024: List of highest wicket-takers 

Tanay Thyagarajan (Hyderabad) - 56 wickets in 7 matches

Ravisrinivasan Sai Kishore (Tamil Nadu) - 53 wickets in 9 matches

Mohit Jangra (Mizoram) - 43 wickets in 6 matches

Bhargav Bhatt (Baroda) - 41 wickets in 8 matches

Dharmendrasinh Jadeja (Saurashtra) - 41 wickets in 8 matches

Here are the last five winners of Ranji Trophy:

Year Winner
2023-24 Mumbai
2022-23 Saurashtra
2021-22 Madhya Pradesh
2019-20 Saurashtra
2018-19 Vidarbha

Ranji Trophy winners with at least two titles:

Mumbai: 42
Karnataka: 8
Delhi: 7
Madhya Pradesh: 5
Baroda: 5
Saurashtra: 2
Vidarbha: 2
Bengal: 2
Tamil Nadu: 2
Rajasthan: 2
Maharashtra: 2
Hyderabad: 2
Railway: 2

ùêïùê¢ùêúùê≠ùê®ùê´ùê≤ ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêåùêÆùê¶ùêõùêöùê¢!

Dhawal Kulkarni takes the final wicket as they beat Vidarbha by 169 runs in the @IDFCFIRSTBank #RanjiTrophy #Final in Mumbai

Brilliant performance from the Ajinkya Rahane-led side üëå

Scorecard ‚ñ∂Ô∏è https://t.co/k7JhkLhgT5 pic.twitter.com/Iu458SZF2F

— BCCI Domestic (@BCCIdomestic) March 14, 2024

Today, Mumbai played their 48th final in Ranji Trophy history, while it was the third final appearance for the Vidarbha team. Mumbai secured their spot in the final by defeating Tamil Nadu in the semi-finals by an innings and 70 runs, whereas Vidarbha earned their ticket to the final by defeating Madhya Pradesh by 62 runs.
